---

## Trash Container Placement

### Placement Time
- Containers may be placed at curb: **After [5:00 PM]** the day BEFORE collection
- Containers must be removed: **By [10:00 PM]** on collection day
- Maximum time at curb: [24 HOURS]

### Placement Location
- Place containers at curb, on the street side of sidewalk
- Do not block sidewalks, driveways, or mailboxes
- Containers should face the street, handles toward house
- Leave [3 FEET] space between containers

### Container Requirements
- Only approved containers from the waste provider
- Containers must have lids securely closed
- No overflow - all trash must fit inside container
- Damaged containers: Contact [PROVIDER] for replacement

---

## Container Storage

**When NOT in use, containers must be stored:**
- Inside the garage (preferred)
- Behind a fence, screened from street view
- On the side of the house, not visible from the street

**Prohibited:**
- Leaving containers at curb on non-collection days
- Storing containers in front yards or driveways
- Visible containers from the street

---

## Recycling Guidelines

### Accepted Materials
- Paper and cardboard (flattened)
- Plastic bottles and containers (#1-#7)
- Aluminum and steel cans
- Glass bottles and jars
- Cartons (milk, juice)

### Not Accepted in Recycling
- Plastic bags (return to grocery stores)
- Styrofoam
- Food-contaminated items
- Electronics
- Batteries
- Hazardous materials

### Tips for Recycling
- Rinse containers - no food residue
- Remove caps and lids
- Flatten cardboard boxes
- Keep materials loose - no bagging

---

## Bulk Item Disposal

### Accepted Bulk Items
- Furniture (sofas, mattresses, tables)
- Appliances (refrigerators, washers, dryers)
- Large electronics (TVs, computers)
- Yard waste (bundled branches, bagged leaves)

### Bulk Item Process
1. Schedule pickup with provider: [PHONE/WEBSITE]
2. Place items at curb the evening before scheduled pickup
3. Items must be at curb by [6:00 AM] on pickup day
4. Do not leave items at curb for more than [24 HOURS]

### Not Accepted as Bulk
- Construction debris (arrange private hauling)
- Hazardous materials
- Tires (special disposal required)
- Propane tanks

---

## Prohibited Practices

The following are **prohibited** in [COMMUNITY NAME]:

1. **Dumping** - No dumping trash in common areas, greenbelts, or vacant lots
2. **Burning** - No burning of trash or yard waste
3. **Extended curb storage** - Containers at curb over 24 hours
4. **Overflowing containers** - All trash must fit with lid closed
5. **Visible storage** - Containers must be stored out of sight
6. **Loose trash** - All trash must be bagged and contained
7. **Improper disposal** - No hazardous materials in regular trash

---

## Yard Waste

### Accepted Yard Waste
- Grass clippings
- Leaves
- Small branches (bundled, under 4 feet)
- Plants and shrubs

### Yard Waste Requirements
- Use paper bags or approved yard waste containers
- Bundle branches with twine (max [4 FEET] long)
- Maximum weight: [50 LBS] per bag/bundle
- Placed at curb on regular collection day

| Waste Type | Disposal Method |
|------------|-----------------|
| Electronics | City drop-off or special pickup |
| Batteries | Retail drop-off (Home Depot, etc.) |
| Paint | City hazardous waste facility |
| Motor oil | Auto parts stores accept used oil |
| Prescription drugs | Pharmacy take-back programs |
| Christmas trees | [Special pickup date] or curb |

- Independence Day

## Violation Process

| Violation | Consequence |
|-----------|-------------|
| First offense | Courtesy notice |
| Second offense | Written warning |
| Third offense | $[AMOUNT] fine |
| Continued violations | Escalating fines |

**Common violations:**
- Containers left at curb after collection day
- Containers visible from street on non-collection days
- Overflowing containers
- Trash not in containers
